title: Bug 10403 - Project creation should confirm the bin directory can be scrubbed
OB: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure, we should confirm that the output directory can be deleted and then rebuilt. Some users are creating projects and pointing the output folder at a bin directory which contains more than just .class files that can be rebuilt from the available .java files.
EB: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure and points the output folder at a bin directory that contains more than just .class files, the system should display a confirmation dialog asking if they want to delete the existing contents of the bin directory and rebuild it.
SR:
1. Open the application.
2. Select 'Create New Project' from the main menu.
3. Choose an existing directory structure as the project location.
4. Specify the bin directory as the output folder.
5. Click on 'Create Project' button.
6. Verify that a confirmation dialog appears, asking if you want to delete the existing contents of the bin directory and rebuild it.
